identificationModule.briefTitle: Replacing Canes With an Elasticated Orthosis in Chronic Stroke Patients: The Influence on Gait and Balance. A Series of N-of-1 Trials
identificationModule.officialTitle: Replacing Canes With an Elasticated Orthotic-garment in Chronic Stroke Patients: The Influence on Gait and Balance. A Series of N-of-1 Trials

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study aims to investigate the effect of an elasticated orthotic garment "Thera Togs" on walking ability and balance in currently cane using chronic stroke subjects (minimum 6 months post stroke) using a series of N-of-1 Trials.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Aim: To investigate the effect of replacing canes with an elasticated orthotic-garment on gait and balance in chronic stroke subjects.

Design Experimental, multiple baseline N-of-1 series with an ABC design with randomised period duration.

Participants Four cane using chronic stroke subjects. Interventions Phase A (9-12 weeks) usual cane-walking to establish baseline values; Phase B (9-19 weeks) intervention: orthotic-garment worn throughout the day with maximal cane reduction; Phase C (9-10 weeks) individually determined follow-up: either no walking-aid, orthotic-garment or cane.

Weekly measurement of Outcome Measures for gait and balance function

armGroups.label: Phase A cane walking (assistive walking-device a cane)
armGroups.description: 9-12 weeks usual cane-walking to establish baseline values. Patients walk with their usual assistive-walking device - a cane.

armGroups.label: Phase B elasticated orthotic-garment - TheraTogs
armGroups.description: 9-19 weeks : assistive walking-device which is an elasticated orthotic-garment worn throughout the day (product name TheraTogs). Cane use maximally reduced during his period.

armGroups.label: Phase C follow-Up
armGroups.description: 9-10 weeks individually determined follow-up: subjects determine whether they walk independently (without assistive device) or with the elasticated orthotic-garment (TheraTogs) or with a cane.

interventions.name: Cane
armGroupLabels: Phase A cane walking (assistive walking-device a cane)

interventions.name: Elasticated worn orthotic-garment
interventions.description: Assistive walking device -elasticated worn orthotic garment

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Functional Gait Assessment from baseline to post-Intervention (up to 28 weeks)
primaryOutcomes.description: Change of gait function between phases A (baseline) and Phase B (Intervention)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Post intervention up to 28 weeks (on average 21.5 weeks)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Trunk-sway from baseline to post-Intervention (up to 28 weeks)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change of trunk-sway at body center-of-mass during walking measured as Total-Angle-Area(TAA°) in frontal and sagittal-planes measured with a gyroscope "Sway Star" between phases A (baseline) and Phase B (Intervention)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Post intervention up to 28 weeks (on average 21.5 weeks)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Chronic stroke (\> six months since last stroke)
* Independent cane walkers. Subjects usually use canes to walk inside (this could be intermittent changing from cane to holding furniture etc.) and always when outside
* A Mini Mental Score of 22 or above.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients at risk of falling identified as a Berg Balance Score ≤42/56
